# Task: Code Cleanup and Final Polish


## Objective
Perform final code cleanup, remove dead code, optimize performance, and ensure code quality standards are met.

## Rules Compliance
Run all linters, formatters, and quality checks. Ensure no technical debt is introduced.

## Context
Before releasing, we need to ensure the codebase is clean, well-organized, and meets all quality standards. This includes removing unused code, optimizing performance bottlenecks, and ensuring consistent style.

## Requirements
- Remove dead code and unused dependencies
- Run and fix all linter warnings
- Optimize any performance bottlenecks identified
- Ensure consistent code formatting
- Update dependency versions to latest stable

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Code Cleanup
Remove commented code, unused imports, and dead code paths. Clean up any temporary debug logging.

### 2. Quality Checks
Run all linters and quality tools. Fix any warnings or issues identified.

### 3. Performance Review
Profile the application and optimize any identified bottlenecks.

## Definition of Done
- [x] All dead code removed and linters pass clean

## Testing
- All tests pass
- No linter warnings
- Performance meets requirements
- Code coverage maintained or improved

## Completion Checklist
- [ ] All requirements met
- [ ] Self-review completed
- [ ] Final quality check passed

## Notes
This is the final polish pass. Take time to review the entire codebase with fresh eyes and ensure it meets professional standards.
